p: Serological studies of NoVs necessarily rely on the expression of synthetic antigens, and the baculovirus system appears to be particularly adequate since the baculovirus-expressed full-length VP1 of NoVs is assembled into virus-like particles (VLPs) morphologically and antigenically indistinguishable from wild-type NoVs [ 61]. ELISAs based on VLPs have successfully been used to gather information on the epidemiology of NoVs in humans and animals [ 50, 62, 63, 64, 65, 66]. To date, only one seroprevalence investigation was performed in the cat population in Italy [ 50] by using an ELISA assay based on the VLPs of the GIV.2 NoV strain lion/Pistoia-387/06/IT [ 25].
